Trade/Device Name(s): BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System - Minocycline (1-32 μg/mL)
BD Phoenix™Automated Microbiology System Minocycline (1-32 μg/mL) - Gram-Negative ID/AST or AST only
BD PhoenixTM Automated Microbiology System for use with the antimicrobial agent Minocycline (1-32 ug/mL) - Gram-negative ID/AST or AST only Phoenix panels
Regulation Name(s): Fully Automated Short-Term Incubation Cycle Antimicrobial Susceptibility Devices
Specimen Type(s): Isolates from pure culture of Gram-negative bacteria
Isolates from pure culture of Gram-positive bacteria
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System panels with Minocycline for automated antimicrobial susceptibility testing of Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria.
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for in vitro quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility by MIC for most Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria (including Enterobacteriaceae and Non-Enterobacteriaceae) and most Gram-positive bacteria (Staphylococcus, Enterococcus, Streptococcus) using Minocycline on BD Phoenix panels.
